transcript.text: Yup this is what happens when you decide to drink coffee before filming a video. Well we haven't slept for days
so you guys couldn't sleep for days after having seen my video? (satanic laugh)
BOOM
How weak. Well guys I just found a
new horrific thread and this time what's freaky is that it could totally happen to all of us. It's
horrible. Are you ready to not sleep? I am, so let's go! Today we're going to talk about what happened
to Ryan akka @lustforlove on Twitter.
Incredibly that's when every horror stories start. Don't go outside In August.
Ryan's neighbour asked him to look after her dog for five days for a $40 a day
Which is pretty cool
He decides to share this news with his community by tweeting : f*** my neighbour asked me to keep her dog next week she told me she will give me 40 dollards for 5 days
Three days later, Ryan tells us that he visited his neighbour
And that he's got things to tell us
First of all, when he arrived at her house, it was completely dark
even though it was only 7pm and in the middle of
it's definitely not dark yet at 7pm
And when he says it was dark, the room was really dark, he couldn't see anything in the house
Apparently this woman is 40 years old and lives alone in a gigantic house
Ryan tells us that he hasn't got any problem with that, he isn't judging
but that it's still scary to see someone living in a place that is 10 times too big for him
It's not like you're jealous or whatever but you're thinking: "f*ck, he lives alone in this house, he must be depressed"
Or maybe he isn't alone and his family died..?
Then Ryan tells us that he was kinda scared because she was talking in a weird way
And while she was talking to Ryan
She needed to touch parts of Ryan's body
Very strange,  very tactile woman
Ryan tells us that he has a bad time when he meets her but he says to himself whatever I don't care it's just for five days, I'm gonna make some money, c'mon, let's go
The woman ends up bringing him into a dark room that has the dog in a little cage. The woman says to him
to keep it in the cage when he's taking care of it, and to let it leave
only when it needs to go pee and he thinks well what the hell is this?
A dog isn't made to be in a cage in a dark, humid room.
You let it walk around in your yard. You.. I dunno..
a dog, it's..it's a living thing like us, it needs to enjoy life a little.
Okay, yes, I'm sending a message, yes okay. So he continues to talk, and the woman that
she already had to get people to talk care of her dog but some of them
poisoned him and so she had to take care of them.
The people who poisoned her dog. What do you mean by that..?
That's the moment that Ryan thinks he's going to leave the job to someone else
that it's way too creepy, way too weird, the ambiance in this house and the way the woman is
and then in the end
he thinks of the money, he says honestly it's for five days,
I'm going to take care of a dog  that she probably treats like shit. Once the job is done
I'll never see her ever in my life, who cares, come on let's go.
Bryan goes back home. It's August 15th and and he starts watching the dog on August 16th
the next day. So he's joking, he says not to worry,
that he'll find where she's hiding the bodies of the people she's killed.
Nice joke, Ryan, nice joke. Let's wait to spend the night
alone in this house. It's August 16th, Ryan goes to his neigbour's house.
He posts a quick video of himself walking in the house
and this f*cking house is depressing, dude.
What a nightmare, f*ck. It's like the house in Resident Evil 7
where there's a shady family. I'm sure it's that house there that's in the game.
Let's not lie to ourselves it's also the way that it's filmed.
He's got his phone on flash. It's all creepy. Anyway!
He walks around in the rooms to see if there's anybody.
He takes some photos for us.
But he posts a video of something weird that grabs my attention
because it's super sketchy.
Dude. Why is there a doll sitting on a chair
that's looking at the bed?
It's probably the same one actually where David sits every night when...
Everything's creepy..look at the mattress, dude.
There's no sheets on it. It's two mattresses stacked.
Even the clock has been placed on the carpet, you could have hung it, dude, it's too weird.
It's at that moment that everybody tells Ryan to get out.
There's even a chick who says :
Run !
She's right. Ryan continues to look around the house,
that's normal, he's going to sleep there for four days, he's rather interested
in what there is inside.
He tells us that all the rooms in the house are open except one for which he does not have the key.
According to him, this room leads to the basement.
The basement that maybe contains the people that the woman killed, I dunno!
Ryan notices something else, that since he arrived at the house,
there's been an old radio that makes noise, that crackles
like, you know, as if she had put it between two stations, so there's no music, it just makes noise.
It's just freaky. Ryan takes another photo of the library
which is full of books about
about white Republican extremists. Ryan says to himself, "This is the type of person who would be capable
of committing murder." Next Ryan sends us a video
of a noise he thinks he heard coming from behind a door.
It's for you to judge.
Clearly you have to run away.
You have to stop acting like a horror film when the main character hears a noise
You know that obviously it's a spirit that wants to cut off his head, but he goes anyway, you never know.
Run away!! F*ck that annoys me!
Someone replies to him saying :
And some guy tells him :
I find that funny.
Sorry, it feels good, it helps me decompress after this damn horror story.
Next Ryan tells us that one of his followers noticed something weird with the doll
in the video that he posted so he decides to go back
to check it out with his own eyes. So Ryan posts a video
saying that he was on his way to the room
with the f*cking doll and he hears a noise from the ceiling.
More precisely, coming from the ventilation.
Stop already! Escape, dude! And the dog dude!
You're there to take care of the dog, dude. You're not even with him! C'mon, am I right or not here?
Ryan tells us that he hears another noise coming from the door in the house's entryway
and he decides to take a video through the keyhole of the door to show us that
there's no one in front of the f*cking house.
F*ck, I'm becoming paranoid because of this video! The dog needs to
go outside to do its business but Ryan says he's too scared to open
anyway door in the house, including the front door so it'll have to wait.
Obviously you can understand. You'd do the same
in his situation, dude. Honestly, the dog, I'd put it in the sink,
or above the toilets.
You're going to figure your sh*t out. You're going to learn how to go pee like a human for five days.
Voila, after I'm getting the hell out, it's all good. No seriously, it's tricky.
Ryan discovers something else. It turns out that under one of the beds
there's some f*cking nails. Oh come on she assembled some IKEA furniture
she knocked over some nails.. she wasn't paying attention..it's..
.... I hope.
Ryan, why aren't you running away, dude? Tell us!
Do you not have any legs? You should have told us. Ten minutes later,
which seems like an eternity for those following the thread live,
Ryan has some news. He tells us he's still alive and that something happened. He says
that he heard something fall in the room with the doll.
He reminds us that he didn't touch anything in this room and that he didn't move any objects.
So he decides, rather than returning to
his mum's house blubbering and calling the police,
to return to the room with the doll to see what happened. Video.
Did you see it? Look closely in comparison to the video we saw earlier.
Something changed. The doll's head moved.
This f*cking doll moved! Horrible.
One of Ryan's followers had a good idea when asking him to look through the book shelves
to see if there was a book about paranormal activity. This could indiquate
that whoever owns the house does weird things like rituals or you knows
and that could explain these phenomenons,
paranormal or not, that Ryan can't explain himself.
And, guess what, he finds some and sends us a little photo of this book.
Ryan realizes that it's only midnight even though it feels like
it's been six hours that he's been in this f*cking house. He says he doesn't want to be like the girl
who dies in every horror film but he asks everyone if he should stay or not
during the freakiest hour, between midnight and 1am.
He starts rereading all the messages telling him, "Dude!
Pack up your sh*t and the dog and escape!"
Some of these message make him really freak out, like one from a guy
who says he's an expert in everything paranormal
and to put nails beneath an intimate space could mean many things.
Either the person is trying to repel something serious and agressive
or else there's cursed zones in the house. So Ryan decides
to get out of the house. No one knows if any of that is true but f*ck
but holy f*ck is it freaky!
Friends, don't hesitate to like this video if you want to sleep.
I find this thread great
because this could totally happen to you in a summer job, when you have to babysit,
when you have to watch a dog, whatever. You have to go to another place, another house,
and you discover the area and you discover with the area some things that are
a little weird, that cause you to be a little uneasy.
And you're stressed and that adds paranoia
and it's horrible you know in this situation you become crazy paranoid, dude.
You have no more objectivity. For you everything is trying to hurt you and everything is evil.
I hope that you liked this! It's a bit different from the two others that I already did
but I really like varying things a little, if you'll allow me.
What I liked about this one is that there's no ending, the dude didn't go all the way to the end
He didn't stay and it's cool, he wasn't the hero in a horror film
who's stupid and dies. It's great, we can only be happy for Ryan!
According to you, what was in that f*cking house, dude?
I just think that the thing with the doll was way too freaky.
Ryan never said if all that was fake or not but in any case
the story seems so true, truer than the other two threads, I think.
It's horrible! It's a little less freaky, but since it seems true,
it's actually freakier in the end!
At least it's 6pm,
it's daylight, it's okay, it's all good. It's not not a stormy night like last time.
Well I wish you all the best and what do I wish you? Good night! Bye!
